page.title: 08Religion _ All Saints Church
page.content: The earlist church was connected with the Priory at Eagle.The first building was probably a small oblong construction with a Chantry at the north east corner.The early Saxon archway and the south wall are the oldest parts of the church.The earliest Norman architecture points to the archway and the narrow north aisle.The tower and the pointed arch in the chancel point to later Norman construction.It was not until the 17th.century that any significant changes took place.At this time the seating was changed and singing galleries were added near the tower. One curious custom was that freeholders were held responsible for the repair of sections of the church fence.This,it is reported led to much misunderstanding.The church once had a fine library and an Elizabethan cup.
